required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Pilot Trial Using BR55 Ultrasound Contrast Agent in the Assessment of Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Clinical Trial Using BR55 Ultrasound Contrast Agent in the Assessment of Prostate Cancer by Molecular Imaging of VEGFR2

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: Pilot study to evaluate the sensitivity and specificity of BR55 targeting for prostate cancer nodules with Gleason score greater than or equal to 7.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 30 minutes after administration of BR55
primary_outcome.description: Using a visual score of ultrasound molecular imaging (USMI) when compared to histopathology results, the sensitivity and specificity of BR55 targeting for prostate cancer nodules with a gleason score that is greater than or equal to 7 will be an outcome measure assessed in this study

arm_group.description: BR55, a new ultrasound contrast agent

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male, age between 50-70 years old
- Increased PSA level >4 ng/mL
- Known prostate cancer
- Scheduled for prostatectomy not earlier than 3 days and not later than 30 days following BR55 administration (with the exception of training cases where this requirement is not applicable)
- Provides written informed consent and willing to comply with protocol requirements
Exclusion Criteria:
- Documented acute prostatitis or urinary tract infections
- Known to suffer from stable angina pectoris and/or proven coronary disease, or have symptoms suspicious of coronary disease
- History of any clinically unstable cardiac condition including class III/IV cardiac failure or right-to left shunts
- Severe cardiac rhythm disorders within the last 7 days
- Severe pulmonary hypertension or uncontrolled systemic hypertension or respiratory distress syndrome
- Received a prostate biopsy procedure within 30 days before admission into the study
- Determined by investigator to be clinically unsuitable for the study
- Participating in a concurrent clinical trial or has participated in another clinical trial with an investigational compound within the past 30 days
